section.title: workgroup
section.para: The workgroup option in the global section should match the netbios name of the Active Directory domain.

section.title: security mode
section.para: Authentication will not be handled by samba now, but by the Active Directory domain controllers, so we set the security option to domain.

section.title: Linux uid's
section.para: Linux requires a user account for every user accessing its file system, we need to provide Samba with a range of uid's and gid's that it can use to create these user accounts. The range is determined with the idmap uididmap uid(samba) and the idmap gididmap gid(samba) parameters. The first Active Directory user to connect will receive Linux uid 20000.

section.title: winbind use default domain
section.para: The winbind use default domainwinbind(samba) parameter makes sure winbind also operates on users without a domain component in their name.

section.title: [global] section in smb.conf
section.para: Below is our new global section in smb.conf/etc/samba/smb.conf.
section.screen: [global] workgroup = STARGATE security = Domain server string = Stargate Domain Member Server idmap uid = 20000-22000 idmap gid = 20000-22000 winbind use default domain = yes

section.title: realm in /etc/krb5.conf
section.para: To connect to a Windows 2003 sp2 (or later) you will need to adjust the kerberos realm in /etc/krb5.conf and set both lookup statements to true.
section.screen: [libdefaults] default_realm = STARGATE.LOCAL dns_lookup_realm = true dns_lookup_kdc = true

section.title: [share] section in smb.conf
section.para: Nothing special is required for the share section in smb.conf. Remember that we do not manually create users in smbpasswd or on the Linux (/etc/passwd). Only Active Directory users are allowed access.
section.screen: [domaindata] path = /srv/samba/domaindata comment = Active Directory users only read only = No

section.title: joining an Active Directory domain
section.para: While the Samba server is stopped, you can use net rpc joinnet rpc join(samba) to join the Active Directory domain.
section.screen: [root@RHEL52 samba]# service smb stop Shutting down SMB services: [ OK ] Shutting down NMB services: [ OK ] [root@RHEL52 samba]# net rpc join -U Administrator Password: Joined domain STARGATE.
section.para: We can verify in the aduc (Active Directory Users and Computers) that a computer account is created for this samba server.

section.title: adding winbind to nsswitch.conf
section.para: The winbind daemonwinbind(8) is talking with the Active Directory domain.
We need to update the /etc/nsswitch.conf/etc/nsswitch.conf file now, so user group and host names can be resolved against the winbind daemon.
section.screen: [root@RHEL52 samba]# vi /etc/nsswitch.conf [root@RHEL52 samba]# grep winbind /etc/nsswitch.conf passwd: files winbind group: files winbind hosts: files dns winbind

section.title: starting samba and winbindd
section.para: Time to start Samba followed by winbinddwinbindd(8).
section.screen: [root@RHEL4b samba]# service smb start Starting SMB services: [ OK ] Starting NMB services: [ OK ] [root@RHEL4b samba]# service winbind start Starting winbindd services: [ OK ] [root@RHEL4b samba]#

section.title: verify the trust
section.para: You can use wbinfo -twbinfo(1) to verify the trust between your samba server and Active Directory.
section.screen: [root@RHEL52 ~]# wbinfo -t checking the trust secret via RPC calls succeeded

section.title: list all users
section.para: We can obtain a list of all user with the wbinfo -u command. The domain is not shown when the winbind use default domain parameter is set.
section.screen: [root@RHEL52 ~]# wbinfo -u TEACHER0\serena TEACHER0\justine TEACHER0\martina STARGATE\administrator STARGATE\guest STARGATE\support_388945a0 STARGATE\pol STARGATE\krbtgt STARGATE\arthur STARGATE\harry

section.title: list all groups
section.para: We can obtain a list of all domain groups with the wbinfo -g command. The domain is not shown when the winbind use default domain parameter is set.
section.screen: [root@RHEL52 ~]# wbinfo -g BUILTIN\administrators BUILTIN\users BATMAN\domain computers BATMAN\domain controllers BATMAN\schema admins BATMAN\enterprise admins BATMAN\domain admins BATMAN\domain users BATMAN\domain guests BATMAN\group policy creator owners BATMAN\dnsupdateproxy

section.title: query a user
section.para: We can use wbinfo -awbinfo(1) to verify authentication of a user against Active Directory. Assuming a user account harry with password stargate is just created on the Active Directory, we get the following screenshot.
section.screen: [root@RHEL52 ~]# wbinfo -a harry%stargate plaintext password authentication succeeded challenge/response password authentication succeeded

section.title: getent
section.para: We can use getentgetent(1) to verify that winbindd is working and actually adding the Active directory users to /etc/passwd.
section.screen: [root@RHEL52 ~]# getent passwd harry harry:*:20000:20008:harry potter:/home/BATMAN/harry:/bin/false [root@RHEL52 ~]# getent passwd arthur arthur:*:20001:20008:arthur dent:/home/BATMAN/arthur:/bin/false [root@RHEL52 ~]# getent passwd bilbo bilbo:*:20002:20008:bilbo baggins:/home/BATMAN/bilbo:/bin/false
section.para: If the user already exists locally, then the local user account is shown. This is because winbind is configured in /etc/nsswitch.conf/etc/nsswitch.conf after files.
All the Active Directory users can now easily connect to the Samba share. Files created by them, belong to them.
